lines.content: Sentinel is a personal chatbot inspired by the Duke project. It helps you manage tasks, events, and deadlines efficiently, all from the command line. This project is configured to use **JDK 17**.
Ensure that your system is set up with the following:
- **JDK 17**: Sentinel requires JDK 17 to compile and run. Follow the instructions [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk) to configure your project correctly.
### 1. Configure the Project to Use JDK 17
2. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** by following [these steps](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
3. In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
1. Locate the `src/main/java/sentinel/Sentinel.java` file in your project directory.
3. If the setup is correct, you should see the following output in your console:
- **Task Management**: Add, list, and mark tasks as done.
- **Event Management**: Schedule events with start and end times.
These are some commands Sentinel has:
sentinel is based on the Duke project template. Special thanks to the original creators and the Java community for their contributions.

* The {@code Sentinel} class is the main entry point for the Sentinel application.
* It initializes the necessary components, handles user input, and executes commands.
* Initializes the UI and attempts to load the task list from storage.
* If loading fails, a new empty task list is created.
* Starts the main loop of the Sentinel application.
* Displays the welcome message, reads user input, parses commands, and executes them.
* The loop continues until the {@code ByeCommand} is issued.
* The main entry point of the application.
* Enumeration of possible command types that can be issued by the user.
todo, deadline, event, list, find, mark, unmark, delete, help, bye
* Generates a response for the user's chat message.
* The GeminiApi handles all AI related requests.
* @param input The prompt sent to Gemini.
// Create the URL object with the endpoint
* @param dateInput The date string to be formatted.
* @return The LocalDateTime object after being formatted by Gemini and parsed.
If there is a missing time, put T00:00:00. Else if there is a missing field or no such date, just return 'null'.
Don't give any explanation or any other answer other than 'null' or '{YYYY}-{MM}-{DD}T{Hour}:{Minute}:{Second}'. \n
// Method to load environment variables from .env file
* The ByeCommand class handles the "bye" command, which is used to end the session.
* When executed, it displays a goodbye message to the user.
* Constructs a new ByeCommand object with the specified UI and task list.
* @param ui   The user interface object for displaying messages.
* @param list The list of tasks managed by the application.
* Executes the "bye" command, displaying a goodbye message to the user.
* @param input The user's input string (not used in this command).
* The Command class is an abstract base class for all commands in the Sentinel application.
* Each command interacts with the user interface and the task list to perform specific operations.
* Constructs a Command with the specified user interface and task list.
* @param ui   The user interface object for displaying messages.
* @param list The list of tasks managed by the application.
* Executes the command with the given input.
* @return String to be displayed on GUI depending on Command.
* @throws SentinelException If an error occurs during command execution.
public abstract String execute(String input) throws SentinelException;
* Factory method for creating specific Command instances based on the command type.
* @param commandType The type of command to create.
* @param ui          The user interface object for displaying messages.
* @param list        The list of tasks managed by the application.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the command type is unknown.
public static Command createCommand(Sentinel.CommandType commandType, Ui ui, SentinelList list)
case mark, unmark, delete -> new ModifyCommand(ui, list, commandType);
case todo, deadline, event -> new CreateTaskCommand(ui, list, commandType);
default -> throw new InvalidCommandException("Unable to create command");
* The CreateTaskCommand class is responsible for creating a new task based on the user's input.
* This command can create tasks of type ToDo, Deadline, or Event, depending on the specified command type.
* Constructs a CreateTaskCommand with the specified user interface, task list, and command type.
* @param ui          The user interface object for displaying messages.
* @param list        The list of tasks managed by the application.
* @param commandType The type of task to create (ToDo, Deadline, or Event).
public CreateTaskCommand(Ui ui, SentinelList list, Sentinel.CommandType commandType) {
* Executes the task creation command with the given input.
* Parses the input to create a new task and adds it to the task list if the parsing is successful.
* Displays a message confirming the addition of the task.
* @throws SentinelException If an error occurs during task parsing.
public String execute(String input) throws SentinelException {
throw new ExecutionException("Unable to execute CreateTask");
* The FindCommand class is responsible for displaying the filtered list of tasks to the user.
* This command retrieves the current filtered list of tasks and displays them using the user interface.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified user interface and task list.
* @param ui   The user interface object for displaying messages.
* @param list The list of tasks managed by the application.
* Executes the find command, which displays the filtered list of tasks to the user.
* @param input The user's input keyword string
* The HelpCommand class is responsible for displaying the help message to the user.
* This command provides guidance on how to use the application and its available commands.
* Constructs a HelpCommand with the specified user interface and task list.
* @param ui   The user interface object for displaying messages.
* @param list The list of tasks managed by the application.
* Executes the help command, which displays the help message to the user.
* @param input The user's input string (not used in this command).
* The ListCommand class is responsible for displaying the list of tasks to the user.
* This command retrieves the current list of tasks and displays them using the user interface.
* Constructs a ListCommand with the specified user interface and task list.
* @param ui   The user interface object for displaying messages.
* @param list The list of tasks managed by the application.
* Executes the list command, which displays the current list of tasks to the user.
* @param input The user's input string (not used in this command).
* The ModifyCommand class is responsible for modifying tasks in the list.
* Depending on the command type, it can mark tasks as done, unmark them, or delete them.
* Constructs a ModifyCommand with the specified user interface, task list, and command type.
* @param ui         The user interface object for displaying messages.
* @param list       The list of tasks managed by the application.
* @param commandType The type of modification command (mark, unmark, delete).
public ModifyCommand(Ui ui, SentinelList list, Sentinel.CommandType commandType) {
* Executes the modify command, which performs the action specified by the command type
* (mark, unmark, or delete) on the task at the given index.
* @param input The user's input string containing the task index.
* Toggles the mark status of a task at the specified index.
* If the task is already marked/unmarked, it displays an appropriate message.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked or unmarked.
* @param mark  Whether to mark (true) or unmark (false) the task.
private String toggleTaskMark(int index, boolean mark) {
* The DeadlineException class is a custom exception used for errors related to deadlines in the Sentinel application.
* It extends the SentinelException class to provide a more specific type of exception for deadline-related issues.
* Constructs a new DeadlineException with the specified detail message.
* @param s The detail message, saved for later retrieval by the {@link Throwable#getMessage()} method.
* The EventException class is a custom exception used for errors related to events in the Sentinel application.
* It extends the SentinelException class to provide a more specific type of exception for event-related issues.
* Constructs a new EventException with the specified detail message.
* @param s The detail message, saved for later retrieval by the {@link Throwable#getMessage()} method.
* The EventException class is a custom exception used for errors related to events in the Sentinel application.
* It extends the SentinelException class to provide a more specific type of exception for event-related issues.
* Constructs a new ExecutionException with the specified detail message.
* @param s The detail message, saved for later retrieval by the {@link Throwable#getMessage()} method.
* The EventException class is a custom exception used for errors related to events in the Sentinel application.
* It extends the SentinelException class to provide a more specific type of exception for event-related issues.
* Constructs a new InvalidCommandException with the specified detail message.
* @param s The detail message, saved for later retrieval by the {@link Throwable#getMessage()} method.
* The SentinelException class is a custom exception used within the Sentinel application.
* It is a general exception that can be thrown to indicate various errors specific to the application.
public abstract class SentinelException extends Exception {

* @param s The detail message, saved for later retrieval by the {@link Throwable#getMessage()} method.

* The FileLoader class is responsible for loading tasks from a properties file into a SentinelList.
* It reads tasks from a file named "tasks.properties" in the "sentinel-saves" directory,
* parses the properties for each task, and creates corresponding Task objects.
private static final Path DIRECTORY_PATH = Paths.get("sentinel-saves");
* Loads tasks from the "tasks.properties" file into a SentinelList.
* @return A SentinelList containing the tasks read from the file, or null if an error occurs.

return tasks; // Return an empty list if the file doesn't exist

* The FileWriter class is responsible for saving tasks from a SentinelList to a properties file.
* It writes the tasks to a file named "tasks.properties" in the "sentinel-saves" directory
* in a format that can be read by the FileLoader.
private static final Path DIRECTORY_PATH = Paths.get("sentinel-saves");
* Constructs a FileWriter with the specified SentinelList.
* @param arrayList The SentinelList containing tasks to be saved.
* Saves tasks from the SentinelList to the "tasks.properties" file.
* Each task is saved with its type, description, and status, and additional fields for Deadline and Event tasks.

* Represents a Deadline task in the Sentinel application.
* A Deadline task has a description and a specific end date by which the task should be completed.
* Constructs a Deadline task with the specified description and end date.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param endDate The date and time by which the task should be completed.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task, including the end date.
* @return A string representation of the Deadline task.
* Returns the end date of the Deadline task.
* @return The end date of the task.
* Represents an Event task in the Sentinel application.
* An Event task has a description, a start date, and an end date, defining the period during which the event occurs.
* Constructs an Event task with the specified description, start date, and end date.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param startDate The date and time when the event starts.
* @param endDate The date and time when the event ends.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime startDate, LocalDateTime endDate) {

* Returns the end date of the Event task.
* @return The end date of the event.
* Represents a task in the Sentinel application.

* The task is initially marked as not done.

* Returns the status icon of the task, indicating whether it is done or not.
* @return The status icon as "[X]" if done, "[ ]" otherwise.
* Returns the string representation of the task, which is its description.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns a character representing the type of the task.
* @return 'T' for ToDo, 'D' for Deadline, 'E' for Event.
* Returns a string representation of the task including its type, status icon, and description.

* Returns a string representing the class type of the task.
* @return A string representing the task type, e.g., "[T]", "[D]", "[E]".
* Checks if the task is marked as done.
* @return True if the task is done, false otherwise.
* Converts a LocalDateTime to a formatted string.
* @return A string representing the LocalDateTime in a formatted manner.
* Pads the hour value to ensure it is two digits long.
* @param hour The hour value to pad.
* @return A string representing the padded hour.
* Pads the minute value to ensure it is two digits long.
* @param minute The minute value to pad.
* @return A string representing the padded minute.

* A ToDo task is a specific type of task that only requires a description and does not have a deadline or time range.
* Constructs a ToDo task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the ToDo task.

* The Parser class is responsible for parsing user input and converting it into commands or tasks.
* It includes methods for parsing command types, task names, deadlines, events, and indices.
* Parses the user input to determine the command type.
* @return The command type determined from the input.
public static Sentinel.CommandType parseForCommand(String ... input) throws SentinelException {
* Parses the user input to create a Task object based on the command type.
* @param commandType The type of command (e.g., todo, deadline, event).
* @param ui The user interface object for displaying messages.
* @return A Task object if the input is valid; null otherwise.
* @throws SentinelException If the input is invalid or the task cannot be created.

// For 'event', taskName is everything after the command and before "/from"

1. todo <task>                                Adds tasks without any date/time attached to list.
2. deadline <task> /by <date>                 Adds tasks that need to be done before a specific
3. event <event> /from <date> /to <date>      Adds tasks that start at a specific date/time and
ends at a specific date/time to list.

<fx:root alignment="TOP_RIGHT" maxHeight="1.7976931348623157E308" maxWidth="1.7976931348623157E308" prefWidth="400.0" stylesheets="@../css/dialog-box.css" type="javafx.scene.layout.HBox" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/22" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1">

<AnchorPane maxHeight="-Infinity" maxWidth="-Infinity" minHeight="-Infinity" minWidth="-Infinity" prefHeight="600.0" prefWidth="400.0" stylesheets="@../css/main.css" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/22" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1" fx:controller="sentinel.gui.MainWindow">

<TextField fx:id="userInput" layoutY="558.0" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="324.0" promptText="Text Message" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="1.0" AnchorPane.leftAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="76.0" />

<Button fx:id="sendButton" layoutX="324.0" layoutY="558.0" mnemonicParsing="false" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="76.0" text="Send" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="1.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="0.0" />

<ScrollPane fx:id="scrollPane" fitToWidth="true" hbarPolicy="NEVER" hvalue="1.0" prefHeight="557.0" prefWidth="400.0" vvalue="1.0" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="43.0" AnchorPane.leftAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.topAnchor="0.0">

assertEquals('T', todo.getTaskType(), "Task type for ToDo should be 'T'.");
assertTrue(listedString.contains("[ ] Test ToDo"), "Listed string should contain '[ ] Test ToDo'.");
assertTrue(todo.isDone(), "ToDo should be marked as done.");
assertFalse(todo.isDone(), "ToDo should be marked as undone.");
